NCS Train 114 is Delayed
Train 114 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 11:59 a.m. is operating 20 to 35 minutes behind due to track construction.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/NCS?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
NCS Train Delays - Track Construction

Due to required CN track construction, North Central Service inbound and outbound trains may be moderately to extensively delayed. Metra is working with the CN railroad to minimize delay times. Visit metra.com for schedule info and to track your train.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME Van Buren Street Station Elevator Is Out Of Service
The  Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use South elevator or Museum Campus elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
115th Kensington Station Elevator Out of Service
The 115th Street/Kensington elevator is out of service.  Customers can use Ivanhoe or 55th/56th/57th Street as alternate boarding stations.  Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
MED Ground Level Boarding

Inbound and outbound trains may be loading from ground level at 75th, 79th, 83rd, 87th , 91st, 95th, 103rd, 107th and 111th street stations. Please wait on the platform visible to the engineer and follow boarding instructions from the conductor.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street. All trains will board passengers from the rear cars on this platform. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  147th St./Sibley Blvd station closed for reconstruction until fall 2024.

The 147th street/Sibley Blvd station is closed for reconstruction until fall 2024. During this time, trains will not stop at this station. As alternates, please use the nearby Ivanhoe or Harvey stations. Updates will be provided once  the rehabilitation is complete and the station is accessible. Metra apologizes for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station elevator out of service until further notice
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service until further notice.  Customers can use the elevator located at 205 N Michigan, which leads to the South Water entrance to Millennium Station
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-W - River Forest Platform 2 Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, May 8, the east half of Platform 2 (island platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the west half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November.

Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Tracks #2, and #4, out of service at Chicago Union Station.

Tracks #2, and #4, are out of service on the south concourse at Chicago Union Station until further notice due to the Canal St., construction project. BNSF, Southwest Service, and Heritage Corridor passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need help, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.

Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Chicago Bears Games
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

The Metra Union Pacific North Line will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

The Metra Electric District and Union Pacific North Line will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

Metra Alert ME - Upcoming track construction to impact schedules and service

Due to a NICTD rail project, passengers at 47th, 27th, McCormick, 18th and Van Buren, will board trains utilizing temporary platform extenders.  We ask that customers at these locations wait behind the yellow line and listen for boarding instructions from the conductors.  Additionally, all Saturday trains will operate on a Sunday schedule on Oct. 12, 19, and 26, and all service may be delayed up to 20 minutes during this phase of construction, click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert - Slippery Rail Season

There's various reasons train service could be affected causing delays. During autumn months when leaves fall on tracks and a train's wheel crush them, a slick oily residue is left behind on the rail. This residue makes it harder for the train to get proper traction to start, stop, and maintain speed. As a result, delays may be experienced during your travel. Plan ahead and allow for extra travel time this autumn season. For additional information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Track work to affect University Park service on Sunday, October 27

The University Park Station on the Metra Electric Line will be closed Sunday, Oct. 27 due to scheduled track work between University Park and Richton Park.

During the one-day closure, Metra Electric Line riders who normally board trains at University Park will be required to use the Richton Park Station. Trains will operate to and from Richton Park on their regular Sunday schedule, click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District 147th Street/Sibley Station Will Reopen Monday, October 28

Metra Electric Disitrict's 147th street/Sibley Blvd station will reopen to passengers Monday, October 28th. The station has been fully renovated which includes an elevator making it ADA acccessible. For more information, visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Phase two of track construction impacting schedules and service Oct. 26-27

Phase two of the NICTD rail project will be taking place Saturday and Sunday, October 26-27. During this time inbound trains traveling from 63rd street through Van Buren station may not board from its normal platform. We ask that customers allow themselves extra time when arriving at these locations, wait behind the yellow line and listen for platform boarding announcements prior to boarding your train. Additionally, all Saturday trains will operate on a Sunday schedule on Oct. 26, and all service may be delayed up to 20 minutes during this phase of construction. Please visit metra.com for more information.
